chapter.title: Getting started with yocto by vishnu

para.emphasis: To start working with yocto following packages need to install on ubuntu machine

listitem.programlisting: $ sudo apt-get install gawk wget git-core diffstat unzip texinfo gcc-multilib \ build-essential chrpath socat cpio python3 python3-pip python3-pexpect \ xz-utils debianutils iputils-ping python3-git python3-jinja2 libegl1-mesa libsdl1.2-dev \ pylint3 xterm

para.emphasis: If you are gona building the yocto reference manual. Following packages need to install to buid documets

listitem.programlisting: $ sudo apt-get install make xsltproc docbook-utils fop dblatex xmlto

para.emphasis: To start working with yocto, we need to clone the yocto source code. Yocto source code is avaiable at poky
Checkout the source code using git clone

listitem.programlisting: $ git clone git://git.yoctoproject.org/poky Cloning into 'poky'... remote: Enumerating objects: 476857, done. remote: Counting objects: 100% (476857/476857), done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (112644/112644), done. Receiving objects: 100% (476857/476857), 163.70 MiB | 4.90 MiB/s, done. Resolving deltas: 100% (356937/356937), done. Checking connectivity... done.

para.emphasis: Checkout latest branch associated with yocto project release e.g zeus (3.0.3)

listitem.programlisting: $ cd poky $ git checkout -b zeus origin/zeus
